newsitem.title: UK: Bass shares rise ahead of results.
newsitem.headline: Bass shares rise ahead of results.

text.p: Shares in brewing-to-leisure group Bass Plc rose on Tuesday, in line with a strong market trend ahead of results tomorrow which analysts expect to show an improvement in full-year earnings.
At 1006 GMT, Bass shares were up 5-1/2p at 799-1/2p while rival Scottish and Newcastle Plc shares were up 4p at 665p, adding to a 22p rise on Monday following a 26 percent rise in first-half profits.
One marketmaker said the results were expected to be good, adding that people would be looking for any statement on the proposed 200 million stg acquisition of Carlsberg-Tetley.
Recent newspaper reports have said the acquisition may be referred to the Monopolies and Mergers Commission.
Another said the rise in Bass shares was in line with the market. "Figures are out tomorrow but no fireworks are expected," he said.
Analyst forecasts for Bass pre-tax profits are mostly in a range between 665 million stg and 675 million from 599 million a year before.
